item.title: Albrighton Road always absolutely full of litter, 17th June
item.description:
This road, near the community centre, seems to be constantly covered in litter and almost looks like an abandoned road thanks to the litter, the terrible weeds, and the abandoned truck which has been there for a year and is being used as a bin. Please sort asap Southwark, terrible care of your roads.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Albrighton Road, East Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog waste on corner where grove lane and grove hill road meet, 17th June
item.description:
Someone is consistently letting their dog foul here and not picking it up. Pls clear.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Grove Hill Road, East Dulwich, London

item.title: Flytipped wood outside number 62, flytipped matress outside 51, lots of rubbish continually at juntion of Ansdell Road and Hollydale, 17th June
item.description:
Continual flytipping in communal areas of the streets and more and more so outside individual addresses. Mess outside number 62 has been there for OVER A MONTH
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ansdell Road, Nunhead, London

item.title: Vehicle parked in close for weeks not moved. Not taxed or MOT., 17th June
item.description:
Vehicle parked within Blair Close for weeks not moved. Taking up parking spaces that the residents use in the close. Vehicle registration v8 JBS. A yellow Mitsubishi fuso canter.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Blair Close, Falconwood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Green waste added to existing fly tipped building waste, 17th June
item.description:
Garden waste has been added to already dumped building waste in black bags outside a Leontine Close property that backs on to Furley Road. It's blocking the pavement and is starting to attract further dumping. It needs dealing with. This my second report of the problem.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 82, Furley Road, Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Malvern Road, London

item.category: Fly-tip Medium - Up to medium size van load

item.title: Inflatable mattress outside 13 Belvoir road bins, 17th June
item.description:
Neighbour at 13 upstairs once again placed bulky item that is not collected by weekly bin rounds. Was on the pavement and I moved it to the bins but it's not taken away. It's a double bed mattress inflatable. Can imagine how big and heavy it is.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Belvoir Road, East Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping, 17th June
item.description:
There is a constant almost daily case of fly tipping next to this tree people seem to think it’s ok to dump their rubbish there daily Today we have part of a bed frame and general rubbish plus after this photo was taken we have now got a blue recycling bin

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Northwold Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping on Mount pleasant hill, 17th June

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Inver Close, Hackney, London

item.title: SORN van parked long-term in residential bay., 17th June
item.description:
A white Ford Transit van (registration NE53 UKO) has been parked in a shared residential car park on Fleming Way, SE28 8NS, for several moths without moving. I have checked online, and the vehicle is declared as SORN with DVLA, which means it should not be parked on public or shared land. The vehicle is taking up a valuable parking space and does not appear to be in use. Please could this be investigated and removed if appropriate.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hodgkins Close, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: General litter/ overgrown weeds, 17th June
item.description:
The pathway could do with a general litter pick as it’s not attended often enough and is really unpleasant for local residents to look at. Additionally, could we please have the path weeded as they are so overgrown that the steps are being covered becoming a trip hazzard to those less able. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 77, Domonic Drive, New Eltham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned vehicle, 17th June
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Warneford Street, Hackney, London

item.title: Overflowing bin, 17th June
item.description:
While this new bin has been in place the litter has significantly reduced down Kelby Path. However, it doesn’t get emptied often enough and now due to the heat and the sun it’s smelling quite bad. Could we please have this bin checked and changed weekly?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 75, Domonic Drive, New Eltham, London
Report on FixMyStreet
